Public Transportation: Buses, trains, and subways are often readily available in many cities and can be an affordable and convenient way to get around without a car.
Bike Sharing: Although bicycles are disappearing, bike sharing programs could still be a viable option, where users can rent bikes for short periods of time to get around.
Scooters: Electric scooters have become increasingly popular as a mode of transportation, offering the convenience of a small vehicle without the need for a full-sized car.
Trains: In many cities, trains can be an efficient way to travel longer distances, connecting urban areas to suburban and rural regions.
Trams and Streetcars: Similar to trains, trams and streetcars provide an alternative mode of public transportation that can help reduce traffic congestion and emissions.
